name: Strawberry Shortcake
author: Denyse
summary: An old-fashioned, tender shortcake with two layers of strawberries topped with whipped cream.
directions: Slice the strawberries and toss them with 1/2 cup of white sugar
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
Grease and flour one 8 inch round cake pan
In a medium bowl combine the flour, baking powder, 2 tablespoons white sugar and the salt
With a pastry blender cut in the shortening until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs
Make a well in the center and add the beaten egg and milk
Spread the batter into the prepared pan
Bake at 425 degrees F (220 degrees C) for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown
Let cool partially in pan on wire rack
Slice partially cooled cake in half, making two layers
Place half of the strawberries on one layer and top with the other layer
Top with remaining strawberries and cover with the whipped cream
